reviewText: This DIRECT SOURCE double feature of non-American made westerns is also available as a bundle with two other films in theirWILD WEST SHOOTOUTpack.Unfortunately, the better of these, "Cain" is a wretched dub: blurry and washed out. "Blood City" is marginally better but not nearly as interesting to watch.SYNOPSES:AND GOD SAID TO CAIN... - Euro-western directed by horror specialist Antonio Margheriti. Cast includes Gina Lollobrigida's cousin. Familiar but still exciting story of a wrongly convicted man pardoned after ten years hard labor in a prison rock pit who, during a violent windstorm, seeks revenge on the guilty.BLOOD CITY - A reworking of the "Westworld" theme. Several amnesiacs awaken in an Old West town and are forced into slavery. They must engage in and win showdowns in order to eventually face off against the town sheriff.Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll ratings.(6.9) And God Said To Cain... (Italy/W Germany-1970) - Klaus Kinski/Peter Carsten/Marcella Michelangeli/Guido Lollobrigida(5.0) Blood City ("Welcome to Blood City") (UK/Canada-1977) - Jack Palance/Keir Dullea/Samantha Eggar
summary: Direct Source westerns offer indirect transfers
Title: N/A

reviewText: In BLOOD CITY (aka: WELCOME TO BLOOD CITY) a man named Michael (Keir Dulea- 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY, BUNNY LAKE IS MISSING, BLACK CHRISTMAS) wakes up in an unknown landscape w/ four strangers. After a short introduction, the five begin walking. They are attacked by brigands, and one of them is shot dead while the lone female among them is raped. Enter a mysterious man in black (Jack Palance) on horseback, who leads the group to a small town populated by cowboy-types dressed in similar black outfits. Michael and company soon discover that their situation is dire, and something beyond their comprehension is behind it all. BLOOD CITY is a sci-fi / thriller that is sort of a cross between WESTWORLD and a very bizarre TWILIGHT ZONE or OUTER LIMITS episode. Palance and Dulea are great in their roles, as is Samantha Eggar (DEMONOID, THE BROOD) as a technician. AND GOD SAID TO CAIN is a more traditional western, w/ a man (Klaus Kinski- CRAWLSPACE, VENOM) )released from prison seeking revenge on those who wronged him. What makes it special is the creepy, ominous  way in which it is shot. Full of dark, foreboding occurances, this film plays like a horror movie. Though long-winded in spots, it holds the attention, and delivers plenty of bleak atmosphere. This is an excellent double feature!...

reviewText: Both movies are entertaining, and I would love to find better quality copies of them.  This DVD is unwatchable on a wide-screen hi-def TV.  You have to use an old standard-def set, else you'll want to be like (insert celebrity here) and shoot your TV."Blood City" is an oddity, a cross between a western and science fiction.  A group of people find themselves in a sort-of Wild West town where the only way to gain status is to kill others.  The people are actually asleep in a modern-day laboratory, with their situation being sent to their heads through technology (the opening scenes of the movie are of cars on the street, telling you right away this isn't your usual western).  Jack Palance does a fine job of playing the top-dog of the town.  If you've ever seen "The Prisoner" episode "A, B, and C", it's sort of like that, and comes complete with a surprise ending."And God Said To Cain" follows the 'framed, unjustly accused, unjustly sentenced, just released, and madder than hell' revenge formula.  Klaus Kinksi gets his revenge while a storm howls outside.  If you like revenge films, I think you'll like this one.Note: this is also available as part of the double DVD, four movie "Wild West Shootout Pack", available here on Amazon at http://www.amazon.com/Wild-West-Shootout-Movie-Pack/dp/B000TNF9YU/ref=cm_cr_dp_asin_lnk.  The other two movies not only have bad picture quality, but they are bad movies in addition.  So if you're going to buy this, get the double-feature (unless you can get the quad-feature cheaper, of course).
summary: Good movies, but HORRIBLE picture quality
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this movie in a fify movie pack. The picture quality was quite bad. The movie is watchable. Yes, this movie is sort of a rework of ideas we saw in the better movie "Westworld". Jack Palance is good enough in this movie. Barry Morse of "The Fugitive" and "Space 1999" is also in this movie but he has a minor role. The plot seems to be this. People wake up in the desert. They cannot recall their past lives. They don't know why they are where they are when they wake up. The group moves to leave the desert. The group finds some water, which they say tastes like blood. This is where Jack Palance shows up. He is wearing black with a red cross or some sort of + emblem on his shirt. The group is led to a town where they must become ruthless or become slaves. The town has rules that sanction it's violence. One must become violent to move up in society. The slaves are bid on as property. The movie follows the story of one man and he moves upward in the society. From what I could gather from the plot the amnesiacs are actually asleep in a lab. The people have electrodes put up to their heads. The people go into a reality but it is all in their heads. The problem is that people do seem to die in this lab if they are not successful in the western type town. The people in the lab are looking for survivors, people with cunning, people who can be brutal. The scientists are looking for leaders who will be used in their crumbling society.The plot is not fleshed out very well. One is never quite sure what the scientists are doing. All one knows is that the scientists are manipulating the lives of the people who are asleep. Too bad the film quality was so bad. I wouldn't mind seeing it again sometime but in better quality. Still, this is just an ok film with many questions as to what it all means. And the movie has a surprising ending that makes one wonder.
Title: N/A
